notesStmt.note: An image of the verso of the second leaf is not currently available. The verso is blank.

bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman

revisionDesc.change: changed order of final page surfaces and revised notesStmt note; corrected choice encoding of helen price
added mark-up for recto of second leaf and note about leaf being blank
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Add RMBuck handNote; Adams Express, date note, Henry Clapp, Helen Price, Henry Ward Beecher scandal, appointment of attorney general Ebenezer Hoar,
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p: i got your letter yesterday morning it come real quick i was quite astonished to see it was wrote sunday Sunday afternoon George has been home and left yesterday in a tremendous snow storm he went to new york New York to send you 200 dollrsdollars by express i suppossuppose walterWalter you have got it all right he sent some to Jeff also) well waltWalt we have stood it through the storm it was a very bad storm indeed

i am about the same as usual feel pretty well your aunt beccaBecca is better old mrsMrs. man
is back from mobealMobile waltWalt the clapp
i wrote about is the one hellen priceHelen Price spoke to you about being to the falanks Jersey)
poor mrMr. Beecher gets it right and left

walt when you write again tell all you gain about the new attorney Ge George dont don't think he will be to camden Camden all winter as he thinks the brooklynBrooklyn board will stop having pipe made if he staid stayed for the new york New York board he would lose his place on the brooklynBrooklyn)

closer.salute: good bie walterWalter dear i looked for mrMr. OconorO'Connor monday Monday and tuesday Tuesday
